sections.text:
This feature adds automated monitoring to detect drift in our model’s “fit score” outputs, so we can catch when score behavior changes in production before it impacts decisioning, downstream conversion, or user trust. Today, we largely rely on ad hoc checks and delayed signals; drift monitoring provides an always-on safety net that flags issues as soon as they emerge.

We’ll track key distribution and performance indicators over time, including fit score distribution shifts (e.g., mean/variance, quantile movement, PSI/KS-style signals) and—where labeled outcomes exist—calibration and segment-level lift/quality changes. Monitoring will be segmented (e.g., by traffic source, geography, customer type, or other meaningful cohorts) to ensure we detect localized drift that might be hidden in global aggregates.

We’ll define explicit drift thresholds and alerting rules, and when thresholds are exceeded the system will trigger notifications to Slack and/or email. Alerts will include actionable context: the affected model version, the segment(s) impacted, and the time window, along with links to relevant dashboards or investigations so engineering/data science can quickly validate and triage.

Finally, we’ll persist drift events in a durable store for auditing and analysis, creating a historical record of model health over time. This improves governance and accelerates retraining decisions by making it easy to see drift frequency/severity, correlate events with releases or data changes, and prioritize when and where model updates are needed.
